## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been exploring Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and I'm wondering, how do I use them to execute transactions through a centralized authority?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's not how Verus ID and NFT Marketplace work. They're designed to execute transactions in a completely decentralized way, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see. Transactions are executed directly, peer-to-peer, without the need for a centralized authority. This gives you more control and flexibility over your transactions.

**User:**
That's interesting. I've also been looking into Verus Vault, and I was wondering, can I use it to spend funds from a locked VerusID?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you cannot. If you lock your VerusID with Verus Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network to earn rewards, but you cannot spend them. This is an added layer of security and protection for your assets.

**User:**
Got it. And one more question about Verus Vault: is it possible to use it without having a primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it is not possible. Enabling revocation, recovery, and all Verus Vault capabilities requires you to have one primary identity, and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured. This is necessary for the security and flexibility features of Verus Vault to function properly.
How do I use Verus ID and NFT Marketplace to execute transactions through a centralized authority?

You don't. Verus ID and NFT Marketplace are designed to execute transactions in a completely decentralized way, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see. Transactions are executed directly, peer-to-peer, without the need for a centralized authority.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
